access_details:
Directions:  IMPORTANT - DO NOT ATTEMPT TO ACCESS THE CASTLE VIA FONMON VILLAGE


 From Junction 33 of the M4 follow A4232 towards Cardiff.  At the first major intersection take A4050 following signs to Cardiff Airport.  (The A4050 becomes A4226 north of Barry.)  Bypass the airport to the north following A4226/B4265 towards Llantwit Major.  Do NOT take 1st left, which is signposted Fonmon (the village), but continue under bridge for another two thirds of a mile.  Follow brown tourism signs, firstly left towards Rhoose and East Aberthaw.  Then, 100 yards beyond the top of the small hill, turn left again into Castle Road. Go over traffic lights and our lodges are at the end of Castle Road, with the gates on the left.


 ACCESS 2012:

 1 April - 30 September, Tuesdays & Wednesdays. Gardens and grounds open 12pm - 5pm (last entry 4.30pm) and guided tours of the castle at 2pm, 3pm and 4pm.


 Pre-booked weekday tours at any time of the year, with the execption of the Christmas break.

 The Goodwood Collection includes portraits from the 17th to the 20th century, equestrian and sporting paintings, continental pictures bought on the Grand Tour, and 19th century Scottish scenes. description:
The pictures included in this collection fall into two categories:

 1. Family portraits, including persons connected over the years with the family, many by eminent artists.

 2. Pictures built up contemporaneously reflecting changing taste over some 400 years in one family from 17th century symbolist artists, now unnamed, to Kyffin Williams today.

 The furniture and furnishings are representative of the contents of the residences of one family gathered over 400 years.

 Overall, the collection has been described as of historic and artistic interest and importance, particularly in Wales.
name: Portraits, paintings, watercolours, furniture, books and other objects, including works by Lawrence, Romney, Opie, Hoppner and Copley-Fielding

description: Works of art and other objects. This collection consists of paintings, chiefly portraits, furniture and other works of art. The collection of portraits has been described as of considerable historic and artistic interest, containing Waldegrave family portraits throughout the last three centuries. The English (Georgian & Regency) and French (Louis XV & XVI) furniture is of historic interest because of its association with Horace Walpole and Strawberry Hill, Twickenham. There are works by Reynolds, Kauffmann, Gainsborough, Ramsay and Edward Lear amongst others.
